answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

 "How do I close account when AO isn't available - Phones Specialist
Change of AO should be offered first on joint and several accounts, as appropriate, to resolve escalations; see Change of authorizing officer / business owner
If current AO isn't reachable, other authorized parties may be able to close account with documentation
If AO is reported deceased, see Deceased customer
This process is for Joint and Several Liability accounts as business is liable party on account
Contact with current AO isn’t necessary on corporate liability accounts
Business may request account closure only in writing if current AO is unable to be located to request account closure
Ask clarifying questions to understand if current AO is unavailable to contact us to request account closure
Instruct business to request closure of credit card with written request. Written request should include:
Full credit card account number
Name of business
Request for closure
Statement or explanation of why current AO is unavailable or no longer affiliated with business
Signature of alternate officer of business with their role / title listed in signature line
Documentation of requestor's role within business
Documentation may include: Articles of Incorporation, bylaws or\xa0secretary's certificate
Above may be provided by Private Banker to SP09 on behalf of business
When received, we'll work to verify request and close account. We'll also try to reach current AO to close account"

If checking account is closed: QuickAccept is automatically closed"
 "How do I handle annual fee inquiries: Closed account

To avoid duplicate credit, don't adjust annual fee using Fees workflow within 41 days from statement closing date in which annual fee was billed
At customer request, annual fee can be refunded up to 90 days from statement closing date in which annual fee was billed\xa0by selecting Standard\xa0from drop-down in Fees workflow
For non-business account closure, account is closed directly in Close/Retain workflow
This fee is not automatically refunded and can be refunded in Fees workflow by selecting System Issue from drop-down"
 "Account closure reasons in Retention tab
It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab when closing an account so that the bank can learn why customers choose to close their accounts.
Following the three components of a retention call allows us to determine why the customer wants to close their account.
New closure reasons
Explanation
None
Do not select this closure reason
Pricing: Annual Percentage Rate (APR) too high
Customer said their APR is too high
Rewards: Product no longer relevant to customer
Product is no longer relevant to the customer (e.g., SWA or United customer moved out of a hub city, Disney customer is no longer going to Disney or spending on Disney products)
Rewards: Change in rewards program
Rewards structure has been modified in a manner which upsets the customer (e.g., devaluation of rewards earned but not redeemed, reduced redemption options)
Rewards: Finds better value elsewhere
Customer said they earn better rewards elsewhere
Prefers: Using cash / checks / debit cards
Customer doesn't want to use credit cards anymore
Prefers: Another bank due to existing relationship
Customer closed their Chase card and keep competitor cards open since they have other banking relationships with that credit card issuer (e.g., checking account, mortgage, auto loan)
Dissatisfaction: Bad customer / service experience
Customer wants to close due to a bad customer service experience with Chase
Important: If it is a bad customer service experience with the partner select Dissatisfaction: with partner.
Dissatisfaction: Credit limit insufficient
Credit limit is too low for the customer
If customer not eligible for credit line increase and has another credit card, line consolidation can be offered onto the card they called to close
Do not proactively offer to consolidate credit line on closed account to another credit card
Dissatisfaction: With partner
Customer is upset with the partner (e.g."

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closures can occur for various reasons, including bank-initiated closures due to adverse actions or incomplete information, voluntary closures by customers, or closures due to bank policy. Some accounts may be eligible for reinstatement, depending on the closure reason and bank error. Rewards can often be redeemed for a period after closure if the account is in good standing. Closure reasons are important for understanding customer behavior and improving services. Delayed closures may be applied in specific situations, such as pending transactions or fraudulent activity. Closure requests can be made through various channels, including phone, email, or correspondence, and must follow specific procedures to ensure proper handling.

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

retrieved_chunks:
What are guidelines: Disconnected calls
If customer requests their account to be closed and customer disconnects before you had opportunity to read or complete closing scripting:

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

Branch representative requesting closure only: Customer presence isn't required as long as branch representative verbally confirms customer was high-risk authenticated before calling for account closure
Business accounts:
Business accounts may only be closed by authorizing officer or Branch Representative; see Customer entitlement matrix\xa0and go to\xa0Process account closure
If authorizing officer's account is closed, business user account and all employee accounts are also closed
If business card owner states no longer using account for business use,\xa0see Non-business use - account closure
Employee accounts:
Closing employee accounts are completed by using Remove User workflow; see Add / remove employees, proxy, or authorized nonuser
Employees may only request to remove themselves
Proxy can close any employee account
Rewards:
If rewards are redeemed through Chase, they are available for at least 30 days from date account is closed or they are lost
If rewards are redeemed through partner loyalty program, they are transferred to partner
Before rewards are used or transferred, they can be lost for program misuse, fraudulent activities\xa0or other reasons described in rewards program terms and conditions
Best practice is to:
Tell customer current rewards balance
If rewards are redeemed through Chase, discuss reward redemption options with customer
If applicable, process redemption or combine points with eligible account before processing account closure
Disney accounts:
All voluntary account closures forfeit existing Disney Rewards Dollars after 30 days
Whenever possible, offer to transfer Disney Rewards Dollars that meet transfer minimums before closing account
Minimum initial transfer amount to cardmember's first Disney Rewards Redemption Card is 20 Disney Rewards Dollars
Subsequent transfers to Redemption Card require minimum of 10 Disney Rewards Dollars
Credit Journey:
Terminating a Chase relationship by closing an account does not un-enroll customer from Credit Journey
If customer wants to un-enroll: See Credit Journey
Branch representatives requesting account closure on customer's behalf must be authenticated; see Connect Us
Disclose account status:
It's important we disclose account status to make sure customers / branch representatives understand how their card is impacted by account statuses
If you're receiving transferred call from another specialist, you don't need to re-disclose status
Only disclose closed status if closure occurred less than 30 days ago"
 "What are Auto-closures at account expiration - declined reissue
Accounts are reviewed approximately 60 days before card expiration and following is reviewed to determine eligibility:
Account status: Closed, credit revoked, security / fraud, bankruptcy, charged off, potential purge, etc. are declined for reissue
Declined for renewal:
Account is updated with closure status CL TR (Closed Triad) after it expires
No new card is mailed
Requesting reinstatement: Customer isn't eligible for reinstatement and wants new account; direct them to chase.com to apply"

question: account closure
retrieved_chunks:
Points earned on bank closure and voluntary closure accounts will be transferred at the close of the billing cycle
Closed accounts must be in good standing and less than 30 days past due to be eligible to redeem rewards
Points can be redeemed for at least 30 days after the account is closed for bank closure and voluntary closure accounts
answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closures can occur for various reasons, including bank-initiated closures due to adverse actions or incomplete information, voluntary closures by customers, or closures due to bank policy. Some accounts may be eligible for reinstatement, depending on the closure reason and bank error. Rewards can often be redeemed for a period after closure if the account is in good standing. Closure reasons are important for understanding customer behavior and improving services. Delayed closures may be applied in specific situations, such as pending transactions or fraudulent activity. Closure requests can be made through various channels, including phone, email, or correspondence, and must follow specific procedures to ensure proper handling.

Before rewards are used or transferred, they can be lost for program misuse, fraudulent activities or other reasons described in rewards program terms and conditions

Subsequent transfers to Redemption Card require minimum of 10 Disney Rewards Dollars

Disclose account status:

If you're receiving transferred call from another specialist, you don't need to re-disclose status
Only disclose closed status if closure occurred less than 30 days ago
answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

retrieved_chunks:
How do I close Business Complete account
Card: Transfer customer to Retail Business Servicing; see Internal transfer numbers
Retail:
If customer requests to close Business Complete Checking account: See Close business deposit accounts - simple closure

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

retrieved_chunks:
What are guidelines: Customer retention end call reasons
Select correct closure reasons in Retention tab when closing account so that bank can determine why customers choose to close their accounts; see Retention Hub
Follow three components of retention call allow to determine why customer wants to close their account
answer: Account closure can occur for various reasons, including voluntary customer closure, bank policy closure, account rejection, and adverse action closures. Customers may request account closure through different channels such as Secure Message Center, email, correspondence, or phone. It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab to help the bank understand why customers choose to close their accounts. Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days after account closure if the account is in good standing. Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement, but generally, accounts closed due to adverse actions or rewards misuse are not eligible for reinstatement. If a customer requests reinstatement, they must write to the Executive Office. For business accounts, only the authorizing officer or branch representative can request closure, and specific documentation may be required if the authorizing officer is unavailable. Annual fees may be refunded automatically if the account is closed within a certain timeframe after the fee is billed.",

Closed accounts must be in good standing and less than 30 days past due to be eligible to redeem rewards
Points can be redeemed for at least 30 days after the account is closed for bank closure and voluntary closure accounts'
 "Account closure
Customer will have at least 30 days from the date the account is closed to use points if:
Account wasn't closed for violating Rewards Program Agreement
We cancel the program
Customer will lose points not used during that time
Upon customer's death, points will automatically be redeemed for cash as an account statement credit"
 "November 2019 renewal ships First Class approximately October 15, 2019)
Attempt to retain customer, if appropriate, even if ineligible for transfer to Retention; see Handle closure requests - Phones / Correspondence
Available credit and cash won't display after closure in First Assist, C3 or customer's billing statement:
Reinstated accounts will have credit available immediately; see Account reinstatement
Only liable party (Primary, Secondary or Authorizing Officer) or Power of Attorney can request account closure; see POA / Agent inquiries for authority levels to determine POA can request Account closure
Consumer and Business accounts:
Branch representative requesting closure only: Customer presence isn't required as long as branch representative verbally confirms customer was high-risk authenticated before calling for account closure
Business accounts:
Business accounts may only be closed by authorizing officer or Branch Representative; see Customer entitlement matrix\xa0and go to\xa0Process account closure
If authorizing officer's account is closed, business user account and all employee accounts are also closed
If business card owner states no longer using account for business use,\xa0see Non-business use - account closure
Employee accounts:
Closing employee accounts are completed by using Remove User workflow; see Add / remove employees, proxy, or authorized nonuser
Employees may only request to remove themselves
Proxy can close any employee account
Rewards:
If rewards are redeemed through Chase, they are available for at least 30 days from date account is closed or they are lost
If rewards are redeemed through partner loyalty program, they are transferred to partner
Before rewards are used or transferred, they can be lost for program misuse, fraudulent activities\xa0or other reasons described in rewards program terms and conditions
Best practice is to:
Tell customer current rewards balance
If rewards are redeemed through Chase, discuss reward redemption options with customer
If applicable, process redemption or combine points with eligible account before processing account closure
Disney accounts:
All voluntary account closures forfeit existing Disney Rewards Dollars after 30 days
Whenever possible, offer to transfer Disney Rewards Dollars that meet transfer minimums before closing account
Minimum initial transfer amount to cardmember's first Disney Rewards Redemption Card is 20 Disney Rewards Dollars
Subsequent transfers to Redemption Card require minimum of 10 Disney Rewards Dollars
Credit Journey:
Terminating a Chase relationship by closing an account does not un-enroll customer from Credit Journey
If customer wants to un-enroll: See Credit Journey
Branch representatives requesting account closure on customer's behalf must be authenticated; see Connect Us
Disclose account status:
It's important we disclose account status to make sure customers / branch representatives understand how their card is impacted by account statuses
If you're receiving transferred call from another specialist, you don't need to re-disclose status
Only disclose closed status if closure occurred less than 30 days ago"
 "What are Auto-closures at account expiration - declined reissue
Accounts are reviewed approximately 60 days before card expiration and following is reviewed to determine eligibility:
Account status: Closed, credit revoked, security / fraud, bankruptcy, charged off, potential purge, etc. are declined for reissue
Declined for renewal:
Account is updated with closure status CL TR (Closed Triad) after it expires
No new card is mailed
Requesting reinstatement: Customer isn't eligible for reinstatement and wants new account; direct them to chase.com to apply"
 "How do I process account closure
Only Team Leaders, SP06, SP07, Email and Correspondence use C3 to close account if First Assist is unavailable or if correction to account reopened in error is required:
If scenario found in Use Close / Retain workflow instead of Retention tab in Retention tab, follow steps below
Other requests: See Retention tab
Remember: You may be prompted through Retention tab to access Close / Retain workflow, follow this process when prompted
Determine how request was received:
Email: Go to next step
Correspondence: Go to next step
Phone: Go to Step 4
Confirm if account number was provided in request:
If YES: Go to Step 4
If NO: Try to locate account number using First Assist, Admin tool or ICAL; see Customer research: Locating customer or account and go to next step
Verify if you were able to locate account number:
If YES: Go to next step
If YES and account number not specified: Send COR712
If NO:
Correspondence: Log out File 13; END
Email: Tell customer you need full 16-digit account number to process request; END
Determine who's making request:
Primary, secondary, authorizing officer or\xa0Branch banker: Go to next step
If Branch banker, authenticate banker using Connect Us; see Connect Us
When banker is authenticated, determine if customer was high-risk authenticated before calling:
If YES:\xa0Go to next step
If NO:\xa0Tell banker you cannot continue with account closure; END
Employee and attempting to close their own account: See Add / remove employees, proxy, or authorized nonuser
Power of Attorney (POA) / Conservator / Guardian: See POA / Agent inquiries for authority levels
Authorized user / third party / employee not attempting to close their own account:
Phones: Tell caller to have liable party contact us to make request; END
Correspondence: Send NOT004; END
Email: Tell customer only liable party can make request and to have them contact Chase; END
Determine if customer has requested due date change:
If YES: Process due date change; see Due date change and go to next step
If NO: Go to next step
Verify if customer / branch representative\xa0is requesting to close account today:
If YES:
Correspondence / Email: Go to next step
Phones: Go to Step 8
If NO and:
Requesting future date or how to close account:
Correspondence, Phones and Email: Tell customer we're unable to schedule future account closures and to let us know when they are ready for assistance; END
Only inquiring how to close their account:
Phones and Email: Tell customer how to close account; END
Determine if request needs to be routed / redirected; see Routing cases to different queues:
If YES: Route / redirect as instructed
Correspondence: Memo account with actions taken; END
Email: See Routing cases to different queues
If YES and working redirect request: Go to next step
If NO: Go to next step
Determine if account is already closed:
If YES:\xa0Tell customer / branch representative account is already closed; see Account status reference guide;\xa0END
If NO: Go to Step 10
If First Assist unavailable (eligible groups only; see above): Access IAGI in C3 and check ACCOUNT STATUS field to see if account has Closed status
If YES: Access MASC in C3 and go to next step
If NO: Go to Step 11
Determine if account is closed by checking closure date in ACCOUNT CLOSED field:
Closed:
Phones and Email: Tell customer account is already closed; END
Correspondence: Send CLO005, memo account with actions taken; END
Review account to make sure annual membership fee was reversed if applicable; see Annual fee inquiries for details
Open:
Correspondence / Email / Phones: Go to Step 11
Remember:
If account is credit revoked (CR), you can view memos or MACL to verify date
If account is already closed, don't change reason code to show closed per customer request (V2)
Access Close / Retain workflow in First Assist and determine reason for closure; see following examples mentioned in this step, choose appropriate reason and go to Step 12
APR Inquiry: No lower rate available / not eligible for retention (APR Specialists only)
Close: Account no longer needed
Phones:
If closure request came from authorized POA / Agent:
See POA / Agent inquiries
Follow workflow
Read closure script in First Assist
Go to Step 12
Other closure requests: See Retention tab for processing request
Account eligible for CRT: Connect call to CRT by clicking button; END
Remember: If customer declines transfer to CRT, follow retention process
Account ineligible for CRT: Return to Retention tab for closure; END
If scenario found in Use Close / Retain workflow instead of Retention tab in Retention tab, follow workflow and read closure script in First assist to customer; go to Step 12
Email: Delete any system generated letter in C3, unless requested; see Letters - viewing, sending and deleting
Change in terms or Right to Reject: APR or annual fee recently changed or assessed (not minimum payment change)
Non Business Use (business card only): This closure reason should only be used when it has been determined that account isn't being used for business related purchases
When account is closed for non-business use, it can't be reopened; see Non-business use - account closure
Eligible annual fees won't be automatically refunded; see Handle annual fee inquiries - closed account section of Annual fee inquiries
Account Rejection: Account hasn't been used (no payments or purchases):
Only populates if cards haven't been activated / verified and no customer transactions (i.e."
 'Important things to know
Use to assist business card Authorizing Officer (AO) who no longer uses card for business purposes (i.e. business has closed, ownership has changed or customer states account use is for personal expenses):
Additional information: See Business use
All other business closure requests: See Account closure
Business cards are for business transactions only
Laws and regulations governing business account differ from consumer accounts:
If customer states they no longer use account for business expenses, close account and review other credit card options
Once account is closed for non-business use, it can't be reopened
Unless proven bank error; see Bank errors - reinstatement reasons section of Account reinstatement
Accounts may only be closed for non-business use by Authorizing Officer (AO)
Email / Correspondence doesn't assist non-business use closures. If customer has questions about non-business use, tell them to call Customer Service Center:
"Please call us at the number listed below or on the back of your card for more assistance with this request."Non-business use account closures aren't retention eligible
Rewards:
Redeemed through Chase are available for at least 30 days from date account is closed or they will be lost
Redeemed through partner loyalty program will be transferred to partner
Can be lost for program misuse, fraudulent activities or\xa0other reasons described in rewards program terms and conditions before being used or transferred
Best practice:
Tell customer current rewards balance
If rewards redeemed through Chase, discuss reward redemption options with customer
If applicable, process redemption or combine points with eligible account before processing account closure'
 "How do I close account when AO isn't available - Phones Specialist
Change of AO should be offered first on joint and several accounts, as appropriate, to resolve escalations; see Change of authorizing officer / business owner
If current AO isn't reachable, other authorized parties may be able to close account with documentation
If AO is reported deceased, see Deceased customer
This process is for Joint and Several Liability accounts as business is liable party on account
Contact with current AO isn’t necessary on corporate liability accounts
Business may request account closure only in writing if current AO is unable to be located to request account closure
Ask clarifying questions to understand if current AO is unavailable to contact us to request account closure
Instruct business to request closure of credit card with written request. Written request should include:
Full credit card account number
Name of business
Request for closure
Statement or explanation of why current AO is unavailable or no longer affiliated with business
Signature of alternate officer of business with their role / title listed in signature line
Documentation of requestor's role within business
Documentation may include: Articles of Incorporation, bylaws or\xa0secretary's certificate
Above may be provided by Private Banker to SP09 on behalf of business
When received, we'll work to verify request and close account. We'll also try to reach current AO to close account"
 "How do I close Business Complete account
Card: Transfer customer to Retail Business Servicing; see Internal transfer numbers
Retail:
If customer requests to close Business Complete Checking account: See Close business deposit accounts - simple closure
If customer uses QuickAccept: QuickAccept is feature of Chase Business Complete Checking and can't be closed by customer but may be closed by Chase for terms of service or other risk related activity
If checking account is closed: QuickAccept is automatically closed"
 "How do I handle annual fee inquiries: Closed account
See Account closure for guidelines
Annual fee will be refunded automatically in full if customer closes their account within 41 days from statement closing date, in which annual fee was billed
To avoid duplicate credit, don't adjust annual fee using Fees workflow within 41 days from statement closing date in which annual fee was billed
At customer request, annual fee can be refunded up to 90 days from statement closing date in which annual fee was billed\xa0by selecting Standard\xa0from drop-down in Fees workflow
For non-business account closure, account is closed directly in Close/Retain workflow
This fee is not automatically refunded and can be refunded in Fees workflow by selecting System Issue from drop-down"
 "Account closure reasons in Retention tab
It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab when closing an account so that the bank can learn why customers choose to close their accounts.
Following the three components of a retention call allows us to determine why the customer wants to close their account.
New closure reasons
Explanation
None
Do not select this closure reason
Pricing: Annual Percentage Rate (APR) too high
Customer said their APR is too high
Rewards: Product no longer relevant to customer
Product is no longer relevant to the customer (e.g., SWA or United customer moved out of a hub city, Disney customer is no longer going to Disney or spending on Disney products)
Rewards: Change in rewards program
Rewards structure has been modified in a manner which upsets the customer (e.g., devaluation of rewards earned but not redeemed, reduced redemption options)
Rewards: Finds better value elsewhere
Customer said they earn better rewards elsewhere
Prefers: Using cash / checks / debit cards
Customer doesn't want to use credit cards anymore
Prefers: Another bank due to existing relationship
Customer closed their Chase card and keep competitor cards open since they have other banking relationships with that credit card issuer (e.g., checking account, mortgage, auto loan)
Dissatisfaction: Bad customer / service experience
Customer wants to close due to a bad customer service experience with Chase
Important: If it is a bad customer service experience with the partner select Dissatisfaction: with partner.
Dissatisfaction: Credit limit insufficient
Credit limit is too low for the customer
If customer not eligible for credit line increase and has another credit card, line consolidation can be offered onto the card they called to close
Do not proactively offer to consolidate credit line on closed account to another credit card
Dissatisfaction: With partner
Customer is upset with the partner (e.g."
 "Important things to know
Audience: Centralized Control Team (CCT)
Reopen requests are submitted through Closing Desk when a Line of Business (LOB) determines a previously restricted account should be reopened and don't have access to open account in real time
CCT receives reopen request initiated through Closing Desk in Pending Reopens queue and conducts additional review on account to determine if account reopen request should be approved or denied based on their research
Approve or deny reopen requests after reviewing customer's account
Closing Desk events are added real time and worked same business day before 5 p.m. ET
Submit opportunities found into Business Support System (BSS)"
 "How do I work batch account closure queue
Specialists assigned to work in Corr GE queue works off reports created by Operations Coordinators and complete daily; see Batch account closure queue
Don't work directly in queue unless instructed
Remember to return unfinished reports to Team Leader at end of shift
Access account from Corr GE report (Excel file)
Access account; see First Assist information
Verify account number and author of correspondence matches First Assist verification screen and enter account
Determine if customer has credit balance and requested it to be sent:
If YES: See Credit balance refund requests to process request first and go to next step
If NO: Go to next step
Verify customer is requesting to close account today:
If YES: Go to next step
If NO and requesting future date or how to close account:
Tell customer we can't schedule future account closures
Send appropriate response, memo account with actions taken; END
Access Close / Retain workflow in First Assist to determine reason for closure and choose appropriate reason and select Close Acct:
APR Inquiry: No lower rate available / not eligible for retention (APR Advisors only)
Close: Account no longer needed
Change in terms right to reject: APR or annual fee recently changed or assessed (not minimum payment change)
Account Rejection: Account hasn't been used (no payments or purchases)
Only populates if cards haven't been activated / verified and no customer transactions (e.g. payments, purchases, cash advances, balance transfers) have occurred on account
Fees aren't considered customer-initiated transactions and are automatically removed when Account Rejection is selected
Send appropriate letter / template based on balance to confirm closure and memo account with actions taken:
Zero balance: CLO004
Balance: CLO002
Fees refunded: CLO003
Credit balance: Send appropriate response
Previously closed: CLO005
Remember: Use logout code AC"]

question: closure
retrieved_chunks:
What are Bank initiated closures
Remember: Some accounts might be eligible for reinstatement; see corresponding procedures for proper handling
Correspondence / Email Specialists: Tell customer account has been closed and if they need more information regarding closure to call Chase
Adverse action closures: Account that is closed due to adverse action
Based on information provided to us or account behavior
Call handling: If customer wants more information about adverse action account closure reasons, cold transfer customer according to information below or found in account memo; see Internal transfer numbers
Account is not eligible for reinstatement
Customer Identification Program closure (CIP): Chase is required to obtain, verify and record information that identifies who opens an account. Account was closed due to recent review and information was found to be incomplete or inaccurate
Letter sent to customer requesting proof of unverified information and acceptable documents.
answer: Account closures can occur for various reasons, including bank-initiated closures due to adverse actions or incomplete information, voluntary closures by customers, or closures due to bank policy. Some accounts may be eligible for reinstatement, depending on the closure reason and bank error. Rewards can often be redeemed for a period after closure if the account is in good standing. Closure reasons are important for understanding customer behavior and improving services. Delayed closures may be applied in specific situations, such as pending transactions or fraudulent activity. Closure requests can be made through various channels, including phone, email, or correspondence, and must follow specific procedures to ensure proper handling.

Delayed closures must be used in conjunction with approve zones

See Control zones"]

 "Account closure reasons in Retention tab
It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab when closing an account so that the bank can learn why customers choose to close their accounts.
Following the three components of a retention call allows us to determine why the customer wants to close their account.
New closure reasons
Explanation
None
Do not select this closure reason
Pricing: Annual Percentage Rate (APR) too high
Customer said their APR is too high
Rewards: Product no longer relevant to customer
Product is no longer relevant to the customer (e.g., SWA or United customer moved out of a hub city, Disney customer is no longer going to Disney or spending on Disney products)
Rewards: Change in rewards program
Rewards structure has been modified in a manner which upsets the customer (e.g., devaluation of rewards earned but not redeemed, reduced redemption options)
Rewards: Finds better value elsewhere
Customer said they earn better rewards elsewhere
Prefers: Using cash / checks / debit cards
Customer doesn't want to use credit cards anymore
Prefers: Another bank due to existing relationship
Customer closed their Chase card and keep competitor cards open since they have other banking relationships with that credit card issuer (e.g., checking account, mortgage, auto loan)
Dissatisfaction: Bad customer / service experience
Customer wants to close due to a bad customer service experience with Chase
Important: If it is a bad customer service experience with the partner select Dissatisfaction: with partner.
Dissatisfaction: Credit limit insufficient
Credit limit is too low for the customer
If customer not eligible for credit line increase and has another credit card, line consolidation can be offered onto the card they called to close
Do not proactively offer to consolidate credit line on closed account to another credit card

 "Important things to know
Don't proactively offer delayed closure to customer
Don't use internal term delayed closure when servicing customer. Tell customer Fraud Specialist will discuss options to further assist
If customer has questions or needs delayed closure to be added, modified or removed, cold transfer to Fraud Operations
Fraud may be able to assist after further account review and authentication
If delayed closure needs to be applied to account so security fraud account can still be used, Executive Line (EL06) and Third Shift Specialists (PR06) will cold transfer customer to FEST. If it's Disney account, Third Shift (PR06) will handle instead of transferring
See Transferring fraud related calls
Delayed closure allows customer continued use of security fraud (SF) blocked account(s) for up to seven days, but may be extended for maximum of 21 days after account is reported as lost / stolen
Day after Security Fraud report is taken it counts as day one
Delayed closures must be used in conjunction with approve zones
Once delayed closure is applied to account, target use areas can be identified by applying control zones:
Approve zone must be added for customer to use their account after delayed closure has been applied
See Control zones"]

Important things to know
Opening and closing requirements must be met for every call, including transferred calls
If call drops or caller disconnects early, closing requirements aren't necessary
Third party calls don't go through voice screening; calls follow different process
Calls where account-specific information may be released must be verified; see:
Card Authentication
Retail Authentication
Auto Authentication
More specific open / close requirements may apply to specialty units (e.g. Chase Private Client, Chase Sapphire banking, Chase Disney Debit card, Chase Auto); see unit specific articles, if appropriate

 "Account closure reasons in Retention tab
It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab when closing an account so that the bank can learn why customers choose to close their accounts.
Following the three components of a retention call allows us to determine why the customer wants to close their account.
New closure reasons
Explanation
None
Do not select this closure reason
Pricing: Annual Percentage Rate (APR) too high
Customer said their APR is too high
Rewards: Product no longer relevant to customer
Product is no longer relevant to the customer (e.g., SWA or United customer moved out of a hub city, Disney customer is no longer going to Disney or spending on Disney products)
Rewards: Change in rewards program
Rewards structure has been modified in a manner which upsets the customer (e.g., devaluation of rewards earned but not redeemed, reduced redemption options)
Rewards: Finds better value elsewhere
Customer said they earn better rewards elsewhere
Prefers: Using cash / checks / debit cards
Customer doesn't want to use credit cards anymore
Prefers: Another bank due to existing relationship
Customer closed their Chase card and keep competitor cards open since they have other banking relationships with that credit card issuer (e.g., checking account, mortgage, auto loan)
Dissatisfaction: Bad customer / service experience
Customer wants to close due to a bad customer service experience with Chase
Important: If it is a bad customer service experience with the partner select Dissatisfaction: with partner.
Dissatisfaction: Credit limit insufficient
Credit limit is too low for the customer
If customer not eligible for credit line increase and has another credit card, line consolidation can be offered onto the card they called to close
Do not proactively offer to consolidate credit line on closed account to another credit card
Dissatisfaction: With partner
Customer is upset with the partner (e.g."
 "Important things to know
Don't proactively offer delayed closure to customer
Don't use internal term delayed closure when servicing customer. Tell customer Fraud Specialist will discuss options to further assist
If customer has questions or needs delayed closure to be added, modified or removed, cold transfer to Fraud Operations
Fraud may be able to assist after further account review and authentication
If delayed closure needs to be applied to account so security fraud account can still be used, Executive Line (EL06) and Third Shift Specialists (PR06) will cold transfer customer to FEST. If it's Disney account, Third Shift (PR06) will handle instead of transferring
See Transferring fraud related calls
Delayed closure allows customer continued use of security fraud (SF) blocked account(s) for up to seven days, but may be extended for maximum of 21 days after account is reported as lost / stolen
Day after Security Fraud report is taken it counts as day one
Delayed closures must be used in conjunction with approve zones
Once delayed closure is applied to account, target use areas can be identified by applying control zones:
Approve zone must be added for customer to use their account after delayed closure has been applied
See Control zones"]

How do I handle: Inquires after accounts closed
Accounts closed will reflect the below memo:
Delayed: THE BANK HAS MADE A FINAL DECISION TO CLOSE THE ACCOUNT(S) WITHIN 30 DAYS DUE TO INAPPROPRIATE CUSTOMER CONDUCT. CUSTOMER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED VIA LETTER. DECISION IS NOT REVERSIBLE. NO NEW ACCOUNTS CAN BE OPENED. CUSTOMER CAN CLOSE ACCOUNT SOONER, FOLLOW STANDARD ACCOUNT CLOSING PROCEDURE.
Immediate: THE BANK HAS MADE A FINAL DECISION TO CLOSE THE ACCOUNT(S) DUE TO INAPPROPRIATE CUSTOMER CONDUCT. CUSTOMER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED VIA LETTER. DECISION IS NOT REVERSIBLE. NO NEW ACCOUNTS CAN BE OPENED.
Let customer know:
"Closing the account isn't a step Chase takes lightly as Chase regularly reviews its client relationships and in this case we have made the business decision not to continue the relationship due to inappropriate conduct, and as a result account has be closed"
Letter was sent to customer on < date on memo > with decision; however customer service doesn't have access to letter
Provide below information for:
Banker Support:
If caller has additional questions or concerns: Transfer call to Retail Service by selecting CS Retail from Speed Dial feature in Ribbon
Card:
Here's what you should do:
Destroy all cards and access checks
Contact merchants that automatically bill the account and make other payment arrangements
Tell anyone else who uses the account that it's closed
Review the current terms and conditions - they still apply
Effective immediately, you are instructed to use one of the following self-service options to make payments:
Online at chase.com or the Chase Mobile® App1, or by mail
Refer to your monthly statement for payment instructions.

question: closure
retrieved_chunks:
What are delayed closure: Reasons
Adding delayed closure:
Rush replacement card offer was declined or doesn't otherwise meet customer's needs
Customer has Private Label account (where we cannot offer rush cards) and their specific situations dictate need to delay closure
Customer placed order that hasn't been charged to account yet
Customer has pending balance transfer or access check and account reported lost / stolen
Customer specifically requests that closure be delayed
Customer calls regarding fraudulent transactions on their account and confirms they need to continue use of their card until new card received:
Mostly travel related
Example: Customer is stranded, rush replacement card can't be sent and they need their card to get home
Example: There are transactions in California they didn't make but they're on vacation in London and their daughter is using her card in New York City
Modifying delayed closure:
Customer calls to notify Chase that their flight home has been cancelled and they will need to use their account for additional days
Removing delayed closure:
Customer calls to notify Chase replacement card has been received and no longer need ability to use old account which has delayed closure established

See Transferring fraud related calls
Delayed closure allows customer continued use of security fraud (SF) blocked account(s) for up to seven days, but may be extended for maximum of 21 days after account is reported as lost / stolen
Day after Security Fraud report is taken it counts as day one
Delayed closures must be used in conjunction with approve zones
Once delayed closure is applied to account, target use areas can be identified by applying control zones:
Approve zone must be added for customer to use their account after delayed closure has been applied
See Control zones"]

answer: Account closures can occur for various reasons, including bank-initiated closures due to adverse actions or incomplete information, voluntary closures by customers, or closures due to bank policy. Some accounts may be eligible for reinstatement, depending on the closure reason and bank error. Rewards can often be redeemed for a period after closure if the account is in good standing. Closure reasons are important for understanding customer behavior and improving services. Delayed closures may be applied in specific situations, such as pending transactions or fraudulent activity. Closure requests can be made through various channels, including phone, email, or correspondence, and must follow specific procedures to ensure proper handling.

answer: Account closures can occur for various reasons, including bank-initiated closures due to adverse actions or incomplete information, voluntary closures by customers, or closures due to bank policy. Some accounts may be eligible for reinstatement, depending on the closure reason and bank error. Rewards can often be redeemed for a period after closure if the account is in good standing. Closure reasons are important for understanding customer behavior and improving services. Delayed closures may be applied in specific situations, such as pending transactions or fraudulent activity. Closure requests can be made through various channels, including phone, email, or correspondence, and must follow specific procedures to ensure proper handling.

November 2019 renewal ships First Class approximately October 15, 2019)

Available credit and cash won't display after closure in First Assist, C3 or customer's billing statement:
Reinstated accounts will have credit available immediately; see Account reinstatement
Only liable party (Primary, Secondary or Authorizing Officer) or Power of Attorney can request account closure; see POA / Agent inquiries for authority levels to determine POA can request Account closure
Consumer and Business accounts:
Branch representative requesting closure only: Customer presence isn't required as long as branch representative verbally confirms customer was high-risk authenticated before calling for account closure
Business accounts:
Business accounts may only be closed by authorizing officer or Branch Representative; see Customer entitlement matrix and go to Process account closure
If authorizing officer's account is closed, business user account and all employee accounts are also closed
If business card owner states no longer using account for business use, see Non-business use - account closure
Employee accounts:
Closing employee accounts are completed by using Remove User workflow; see Add / remove employees, proxy, or authorized nonuser
Employees may only request to remove themselves
Proxy can close any employee account
Rewards:
If rewards are redeemed through Chase, they are available for at least 30 days from date account is closed or they are lost
If rewards are redeemed through partner loyalty program, they are transferred to partner
Before rewards are used or transferred, they can be lost for program misuse, fraudulent activities or other reasons described in rewards program terms and conditions
Best practice is to:
Tell customer current rewards balance
If rewards are redeemed through Chase, discuss reward redemption options with customer
If applicable, process redemption or combine points with eligible account before processing account closure
Disney accounts:
All voluntary account closures forfeit existing Disney Rewards Dollars after 30 days
Whenever possible, offer to transfer Disney Rewards Dollars that meet transfer minimums before closing account
Minimum initial transfer amount to cardmember's first Disney Rewards Redemption Card is 20 Disney Rewards Dollars
Subsequent transfers to Redemption Card require minimum of 10 Disney Rewards Dollars
Credit Journey:
Terminating a Chase relationship by closing an account does not un-enroll customer from Credit Journey
If customer wants to un-enroll: See Credit Journey
Branch representatives requesting account closure on customer's behalf must be authenticated; see Connect Us
Disclose account status:
It's important we disclose account status to make sure customers / branch representatives understand how their card is impacted by account statuses
If you're receiving transferred call from another specialist, you don't need to re-disclose status
Only disclose closed status if closure occurred less than 30 days ago
