Remember: Some accounts might be eligible for reinstatement; see corresponding procedures for proper handling
Correspondence / Email Specialists: Tell customer account has been closed and if they need more information regarding closure to call Chase
Adverse action closures: Account that is closed due to adverse action
Based on information provided to us or account behavior
Call handling: If customer wants more information about adverse action account closure reasons, cold transfer customer according to information below or found in account memo; see Internal transfer numbers
Account is not eligible for reinstatement
Customer Identification Program closure (CIP): Chase is required to obtain, verify and record information that identifies who opens an account. Account was closed due to recent review and information was found to be incomplete or inaccurate
Letter sent to customer requesting proof of unverified information and acceptable documents.'
 "payments, purchases, cash advances, balance transfers) have occurred on account
Fees aren't considered customer-initiated transactions and are automatically removed when Account Rejection is selected
Banker Initiated Closure:\xa0Account closure request received from Branch bankers, Private Banking or Commercial Bank Specialist
Access MASC in C3 and tab to REASON CODE field along CLOSED line. Key appropriate closure reason based on why customer is closing account; press Enter:
Rejecting change in terms within time frames: CT
Any other reason: V2
Remember: Memo account with actions taken using C3
Tell caller:
If customer:
English:
Account is closed
Cancel recurring charges
If rewards redeemed through Chase: Rewards can be redeemed for at least 30 days from closing if account in good standing
If rewards redeemed through partner: Rewards earned will be transferred to partner at end of cycle if account in good standing
Cancelar cargos recurrentes
If Branch Banker, Private Banking or Commercial\xa0Bank Specialist: Inform\xa0appropriate letter will be sent to address on file with further account closure information
Review date account closed."
 "What are reasons account can't be manually reopened
Consumer only:
Voluntary Closures more than 30 days
Voluntary Closures less than 30 days and hasn't received statement in last three billing cycles
Business Only:
Account has been closed due to Bank Policy (BP), unless bank error
Consumer / business:
Account is currently on or has successfully completed Balance Liquidation Program (BLP) / Debt Management Program (DMP) or settlement
Example: CL V6 closure status and Assistance Program (AP) status
Account has been closed for more than 180 days
Account closed due to inactivity (unless proven bank error or disaster)
Status of CRXM, CLA1 or CLA2: Closed in accordance with Global Financial Crimes Compliance (GFCC) standards
If EL06 / SP07: See Credit abuse / Reputational risk account closures
Account status of bankrupt (BK), fraud (FR) or credit revoked (CR)
Exception: Unless bank error
Account closed after disputes adverse action review
Review account memos to determine if account was approved for closure;
Memo example: DRC, ***Adverse Action Review***reviewing excessive disputes on account, submitting for closure approval, do not disclose memo to customer***"
 "Important things to know
See Retention tab to close accounts unless otherwise instructed
Account closures of any type won't delete account or credit inquiry from credit report, including but not limited to:
Account rejection
Bank policy closure
Right to reject
Voluntary customer closure
Customer request to close account may arrive through Secure Message Center (SMC), email, correspondence or phone
Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement; see corresponding procedures for proper handling
For annual fee questions;\xa0see Annual fee inquiries
Accounts are reviewed approximately 60 days before card expiration; see Auto-closures at account expiration - declined reissue for renewal eligibility
If renewed, card is shipped approximately one month before expiration (e.g."
 "Account closure reasons in Retention tab
It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab when closing an account so that the bank can learn why customers choose to close their accounts.
Following the three components of a retention call allows us to determine why the customer wants to close their account.
New closure reasons
Explanation
None
Do not select this closure reason
Pricing: Annual Percentage Rate (APR) too high
Customer said their APR is too high
Rewards: Product no longer relevant to customer
Product is no longer relevant to the customer (e.g., SWA or United customer moved out of a hub city, Disney customer is no longer going to Disney or spending on Disney products)
Rewards: Change in rewards program
Rewards structure has been modified in a manner which upsets the customer (e.g., devaluation of rewards earned but not redeemed, reduced redemption options)
Rewards: Finds better value elsewhere
Customer said they earn better rewards elsewhere
Prefers: Using cash / checks / debit cards
Customer doesn't want to use credit cards anymore
Prefers: Another bank due to existing relationship
Customer closed their Chase card and keep competitor cards open since they have other banking relationships with that credit card issuer (e.g., checking account, mortgage, auto loan)
Dissatisfaction: Bad customer / service experience
Customer wants to close due to a bad customer service experience with Chase
Important: If it is a bad customer service experience with the partner select Dissatisfaction: with partner.
Dissatisfaction: Credit limit insufficient
Credit limit is too low for the customer
If customer not eligible for credit line increase and has another credit card, line consolidation can be offered onto the card they called to close
Do not proactively offer to consolidate credit line on closed account to another credit card
Dissatisfaction: With partner
Customer is upset with the partner (e.g."
 "Important things to know
Don't proactively offer delayed closure to customer
Don't use internal term delayed closure when servicing customer. Tell customer Fraud Specialist will discuss options to further assist
If customer has questions or needs delayed closure to be added, modified or removed, cold transfer to Fraud Operations
Fraud may be able to assist after further account review and authentication
If delayed closure needs to be applied to account so security fraud account can still be used, Executive Line (EL06) and Third Shift Specialists (PR06) will cold transfer customer to FEST. If it's Disney account, Third Shift (PR06) will handle instead of transferring
See Transferring fraud related calls
Delayed closure allows customer continued use of security fraud (SF) blocked account(s) for up to seven days, but may be extended for maximum of 21 days after account is reported as lost / stolen
Day after Security Fraud report is taken it counts as day one
Delayed closures must be used in conjunction with approve zones
Once delayed closure is applied to account, target use areas can be identified by applying control zones:
Approve zone must be added for customer to use their account after delayed closure has been applied
See Control zones"]

question: closure
retrieved_chunks:
How do I close call
Use process to close warm, cold or no transfer calls
Confirm customer doesn't need any additional assistance before transferring / ending call
Example:: “If there is nothing else I can help you with today -" wait for customer to acknowledge
Provide statement of appreciation and include branding statement
Example: "Thank you for calling Chase" or "Thank you for being a Chase customer"
Make sure that there's a pause or delay before ending / disconnecting call
This prevents a potential accidental disconnection from customer
answer: Account closures can occur for various reasons, including bank-initiated closures due to adverse actions or incomplete information, voluntary closures by customers, or closures due to bank policy. Some accounts may be eligible for reinstatement, depending on the closure reason and bank error. Rewards can often be redeemed for a period after closure if the account is in good standing. Closure reasons are important for understanding customer behavior and improving services. Delayed closures may be applied in specific situations, such as pending transactions or fraudulent activity. Closure requests can be made through various channels, including phone, email, or correspondence, and must follow specific procedures to ensure proper handling.

question: closure
retrieved_chunks:
What are Auto-closures at account expiration - declined reissue
Accounts are reviewed approximately 60 days before card expiration and following is reviewed to determine eligibility:
Account status: Closed, credit revoked, security / fraud, bankruptcy, charged off, potential purge, etc. are declined for reissue
Declined for renewal:
Account is updated with closure status CL TR (Closed Triad) after it expires
No new card is mailed
Requesting reinstatement: Customer isn't eligible for reinstatement and wants new account; direct them to chase.com to apply

What are guidelines: Disconnected calls
If customer requests their account to be closed and customer disconnects before you had opportunity to read or complete closing scripting:
Close account in Retention tab and request letter through Utilities tab by selecting Send Letter > All > Closed by Customer
Memo account with reason letter being sent
Closure letter includes important reminders about items including remaining rewards, automatic billings and payments

Select appropriate phrases from Footer drop-down menu based on customer inquiry for closing statement

! Patience

See Control zones"]

Use to assist business card Authorizing Officer (AO) who no longer uses card for business purposes (i.e. business has closed, ownership has changed or customer states account use is for personal expenses):
Additional information: See Business use
All other business closure requests: See Account closure
Business cards are for business transactions only

If customer states they no longer use account for business expenses, close account and review other credit card options
Once account is closed for non-business use, it can't be reopened
Unless proven bank error; see Bank errors - reinstatement reasons section of Account reinstatement

Rewards:
Redeemed through Chase are available for at least 30 days from date account is closed or they will be lost
Redeemed through partner loyalty program will be transferred to partner
Can be lost for program misuse, fraudulent activities or other reasons described in rewards program terms and conditions before being used or transferred
Best practice:
Tell customer current rewards balance
If rewards redeemed through Chase, discuss reward redemption options with customer
If applicable, process redemption or combine points with eligible account before processing account closure
answer: Account closures can occur for various reasons, including bank-initiated closures due to adverse actions or incomplete information, voluntary closures by customers, or closures due to bank policy. Some accounts may be eligible for reinstatement, depending on the closure reason and bank error. Rewards can often be redeemed for a period after closure if the account is in good standing. Closure reasons are important for understanding customer behavior and improving services. Delayed closures may be applied in specific situations, such as pending transactions or fraudulent activity. Closure requests can be made through various channels, including phone, email, or correspondence, and must follow specific procedures to ensure proper handling.

question: closure
retrieved_chunks:
Three components of a retention call
Component
Wording suggestions
Why the customer is closing the account
(Understanding why the customer want to close their account can be used to shape the rest of the conversation. This can help to identify customer awareness gaps and understand how they perceive the card.)I am so sorry to hear that you want to close your account
May I ask:
So we can improve our products and remain competitive, may I ask why you'd like to close your account?
What led to the decision to close your account?
Why do you want to close your account?
What factors led to that decision?
What the customer values in a credit card
(The foundation of a successful retention conversation is an understanding of what the customer values. Everything else in the conversation should spring from this knowledge. Using open-ended probing questions is an incredibly important tool.)Other than APR / annual fee / rewards, what else:
Is important to you in a credit card?
Makes you use other credit cards?
When you use a credit card, what prompts you to use it?
Relevant engagement
(This is the portion of the call when we take what we have learned about our customer and show how the benefits of their card meet those needs. The goal here is to help the customer see how these benefits are relevant and useful in their situation.)Those are great benefits, it sounds like saving money / convenience is very important to you and here is how this card can help you achieve that
You have definitely done your research and it sounds like maximizing rewards / remaining debt free is important to you. Here is how this card can help you maintain that
I definitely understand how you feel. Control / value is very important, here is how this card can help you achieve that
Closing statements
Based on the benefits we discussed today, would you like to keep your account open so you can continue to use your card and receive all of these benefits?
Based on the conversation we had today on the benefits, would you like to keep the account open so you can continue using your card and enjoying these benefits?
With this discussion in mind, would you like to keep your account open so you can continue to use your card and receive all of these benefits?

 "What are reasons account can't be manually reopened
Consumer only:
Voluntary Closures more than 30 days
Voluntary Closures less than 30 days and hasn't received statement in last three billing cycles
Business Only:
Account has been closed due to Bank Policy (BP), unless bank error
Consumer / business:
Account is currently on or has successfully completed Balance Liquidation Program (BLP) / Debt Management Program (DMP) or settlement
Example: CL V6 closure status and Assistance Program (AP) status
Account has been closed for more than 180 days
Account closed due to inactivity (unless proven bank error or disaster)
Status of CRXM, CLA1 or CLA2: Closed in accordance with Global Financial Crimes Compliance (GFCC) standards
If EL06 / SP07: See Credit abuse / Reputational risk account closures
Account status of bankrupt (BK), fraud (FR) or credit revoked (CR)
Exception: Unless bank error
Account closed after disputes adverse action review
Review account memos to determine if account was approved for closure;
Memo example: DRC, ***Adverse Action Review***reviewing excessive disputes on account, submitting for closure approval, do not disclose memo to customer***"
 "Important things to know
See Retention tab to close accounts unless otherwise instructed
Account closures of any type won't delete account or credit inquiry from credit report, including but not limited to:
Account rejection
Bank policy closure
Right to reject
Voluntary customer closure
Customer request to close account may arrive through Secure Message Center (SMC), email, correspondence or phone
Some accounts closed by bank policy may be eligible for reinstatement; see corresponding procedures for proper handling
For annual fee questions;\xa0see Annual fee inquiries
Accounts are reviewed approximately 60 days before card expiration; see Auto-closures at account expiration - declined reissue for renewal eligibility

 "Account closure reasons in Retention tab
It is important to select the correct closure reasons in the Retention tab when closing an account so that the bank can learn why customers choose to close their accounts.
Following the three components of a retention call allows us to determine why the customer wants to close their account.
New closure reasons
Explanation
None
Do not select this closure reason
Pricing: Annual Percentage Rate (APR) too high
Customer said their APR is too high
Rewards: Product no longer relevant to customer
Product is no longer relevant to the customer (e.g., SWA or United customer moved out of a hub city, Disney customer is no longer going to Disney or spending on Disney products)
Rewards: Change in rewards program
Rewards structure has been modified in a manner which upsets the customer (e.g., devaluation of rewards earned but not redeemed, reduced redemption options)
Rewards: Finds better value elsewhere
Customer said they earn better rewards elsewhere
Prefers: Using cash / checks / debit cards
Customer doesn't want to use credit cards anymore
Prefers: Another bank due to existing relationship
Customer closed their Chase card and keep competitor cards open since they have other banking relationships with that credit card issuer (e.g., checking account, mortgage, auto loan)
Dissatisfaction: Bad customer / service experience
Customer wants to close due to a bad customer service experience with Chase
Important: If it is a bad customer service experience with the partner select Dissatisfaction: with partner.
Dissatisfaction: Credit limit insufficient
Credit limit is too low for the customer
If customer not eligible for credit line increase and has another credit card, line consolidation can be offered onto the card they called to close
Do not proactively offer to consolidate credit line on closed account to another credit card
Dissatisfaction: With partner

 "Important things to know
Don't proactively offer delayed closure to customer
Don't use internal term delayed closure when servicing customer. Tell customer Fraud Specialist will discuss options to further assist
If customer has questions or needs delayed closure to be added, modified or removed, cold transfer to Fraud Operations
Fraud may be able to assist after further account review and authentication
If delayed closure needs to be applied to account so security fraud account can still be used, Executive Line (EL06) and Third Shift Specialists (PR06) will cold transfer customer to FEST. If it's Disney account, Third Shift (PR06) will handle instead of transferring
See Transferring fraud related calls
Delayed closure allows customer continued use of security fraud (SF) blocked account(s) for up to seven days, but may be extended for maximum of 21 days after account is reported as lost / stolen
Day after Security Fraud report is taken it counts as day one
Delayed closures must be used in conjunction with approve zones
Once delayed closure is applied to account, target use areas can be identified by applying control zones:
Approve zone must be added for customer to use their account after delayed closure has been applied
See Control zones"]
